Minimal.title: Low Anxiety Levels
Minimal.description: You are experiencing minimal anxiety. Keep up your current healthy habits.

tips.title: Mindfulness
tips.description: Regular mindfulness practice helps keep anxiety at bay.

tips.title: Healthy Boundaries
tips.description: Continue maintaining a good work-life balance.

tips.title: Physical Health
tips.description: Regular exercise is a natural anxiety reducer.

Mild.title: Mild Anxiety
Mild.description: You have some anxiety symptoms. Early management strategies can be very effective here.

tips.title: Breathing Exercises
tips.description: Try 'Box Breathing' (inhale 4s, hold 4s, exhale 4s, hold 4s) when creating tension.

tips.title: Limit Caffeine
tips.description: Reducing caffeine intake can decrease physical jitters and anxiety.

tips.title: Worry Time
tips.description: Set aside 15 mins a day specifically for worrying, then postpone worries until that time.

Moderate.title: Moderate Anxiety
Moderate.description: Anxiety is likely interfering with your days. Structured coping strategies are recommended.

tips.title: Grounding Techniques
tips.description: Use the 5-4-3-2-1 technique: name 5 things you see, 4 feel, 3 hear, 2 smell, 1 taste.

tips.title: Muscle Relaxation
tips.description: Practice Progressive Muscle Relaxation to release built-up physical tension.

tips.title: Challenge Thoughts
tips.description: Ask yourself: 'Is this worry a fact or an opinion? What is the evidence?'

Severe.title: Severe Anxiety
Severe.description: Your anxiety levels are high and likely overwhelming. Professional support is strongly advised.

tips.title: Professional Support
tips.description: A therapist can assist with CBT techniques specifically effective for severe anxiety.

tips.title: Medical Consultation
tips.description: Talk to a doctor about your symptoms; there are many effective treatments.

tips.title: Support System
tips.description: Let trusted family or friends know how you are feeling so they can support you.
